visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object that renders a column chart with the title 'Monthly Sales Data'. The x-axis should display months with labels styled in blue, 12px font size. The y-axis should have labels styled in green, 14px font size. The chart should have two data series: the first series named '2022 Sales' with data [29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5, 216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4], and the second series named '2023 Sales' with data [216.4, 194.1, 95.6, 54.4, 29.9, 71.5, 106.4, 129.2, 144.0, 176.0, 135.6, 148.5]. The chart should use custom colors for the columns: ['#008000', '#FFA500']. The chart should have a white background, a legend positioned at the bottom, and margins set to 50 pixels on all sides.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a column chart titled 'Monthly Sales Data'. The x-axis displays months with blue, 12px font size labels, while the y-axis has green, 14px font size labels. The chart includes two data series: '2022 Sales' and '2023 Sales', each with corresponding monthly sales data. The columns are colored using custom colors '#008000' and '#FFA500'. The chart has a white background and a legend positioned at the bottom, with margins set to 50 pixels on all sides to ensure adequate spacing around the chart.
